allSaves.value: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +2 status to all saves vs. mental

details.flavorText:
Drow have a reputation for evil due to demon worship in their major settlements. However, like members of any ancestry, drow can have any alignment, especially when removed from the demon lords' sinister influence.

The rare few drow who specialize in the repeating hand crossbow command respect not only for their skills but for their luck and swagger.

description.value:
You create a shroud of darkness that prevents light from penetrating or emanating within the area. Light does not enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a torch or lantern, do not emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. This also suppresses magical light of your darkness spell's level or lower. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. From outside, it appears as a globe of pure darkness.

Heightened (4th) Even creatures with darkvision (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed}.

All creatures in the area when you cast the spell are limned in colorful, heatless fire of a color of your choice for the duration. Visible creatures can't be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed} while affected by faerie fire. If the creatures are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Invisible]{Invisible}, they are Concealed while affected by faerie fire, rather than being @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Undetected]{Undetected}.

You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.

This weapon features an ingeniously designed catch mechanism at the top of the flight grove, just in front of the latch, which automatically loads a bolt from a magazine and resets the string each time the weapon is fired. A typical repeating hand crossbow magazine holds five bolts.
The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.
This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

This leather bandolier holds up to three repeating hand crossbow @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Magazine with 5 Bolts]{Magazine with 5 Bolts} in leather pockets that pop open with the quick flick of a thumb. You reduce the reload time for a repeating hand crossbow magazine from the bandolier by 1, to a total of 2 actions. You can wear only one shootist bandolier at a time.
Magazine with 5 bolts for use with the @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Repeating Hand Crossbow]{Repeating Hand Crossbow}.

Activate 2 Interact

Stupor poison is a more potent distillation of @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Lethargy Poison]{Lethargy Poison}. Further exposure to stupor poison doesnâ€™t require the target to attempt additional saving throws; only failing a saving throw against an ongoing exposure can progress its stage.

Saving Throw DC 20 Fortitude;

Maximum Duration 6 hours;

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Slowed]{Slowed 1} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} (1 round);

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Slowed]{Slowed 2} and flat-footed (1 round);

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Unconscious]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up (1 round);

Stage 4 unconscious with no Perception check to wake up ([[/r 1d6 #hours]] hours)

A monster with darkvision can see perfectly well in areas of darkness and dim light, though such vision is in black and white only. Some forms of magical darkness, such as a 4th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Darkness]{Darkness} spell, block normal darkvision. A monster with @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Greater Darkvision]{Greater Darkvision}, however, can see through even these forms of magical darkness.
The monster can cast its at-will spells any number of times without using up spell slots.

When first exposed to bright light, the monster is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Blinded]{Blinded} until the end of its next turn. After this exposure, light doesn't blind the monster again until after it spends 1 hour in darkness. However, as long as the monster is in an area of bright light, it's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Dazzled]{Dazzled}.

items.name: +1 Status Bonus on Saves vs Magic
+2 Status To All Saves vs. Mental

description.value:
Trigger The shootist fails a save;

Frequency once per day;

Effect The shootist rerolls the save and uses the better result.

The shootist takes aim and makes a ranged Strike. If the attack hits and deals damage, the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} until the end of the shootistâ€™s turn, or until the end of the shootistâ€™s next turn on a critical hit.

Requirements The shootist is holding an unloaded repeating hand crossbow;

Effect The shootist Interacts to reload the repeating hand crossbow and Strikes with it.

Frequency once per round;

Effect The shootist Interacts to draw a repeating hand crossbow and Strikes with it, or Strikes with a loaded repeating hand crossbow theyâ€™re holding then Interacts to stow it.
The shootist deals an extra [[/r 2d6 #precision]] precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

Stupor poison is a more potent distillation of @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Lethargy Poison]{Lethargy Poison}. Further exposure to stupor poison doesnâ€™t require the target to attempt additional saving throws; only failing a saving throw against an ongoing exposure can progress its stage.

Saving Throw Fortitude;

Maximum Duration 6 hours;

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Slowed]{Slowed 1} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} (1 round);

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Slowed]{Slowed 2} and flat-footed (1 round);

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Unconscious]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up (1 round);

Stage 4 unconscious with no Perception check to wake up ([[/r 1d6 #hours]] hours)
